poem:
**Volatility**  

In the sharp wind  
of election's breath,  
a dollar's dance,  
the skittish leap—  
green fades  
like a whisper,  
  
bonds bend low  
in anticipation,  
digits waver,  
pause, flight—  
where is the  
certainty of sun?  
  
On Tuesday,  
decisions, like leaves,  
fall.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Investors brace for volatile trading week as US election draws near Global investors are bracing for a week of volatile trading in financial markets before one of the most closely fought US elections in history. As voters in the world’s largest economy prepare to head to the polls on Tuesday, the dollar and the yield on US Treasury bonds fell on Monday as investors pared bets on a Donald Trump victory. The greenback dipped 0.6%". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Investors brace for volatile trading week as US election draws near Global investors are bracing for a week of volatile trading in financial markets before one of the most closely fought US elections in history. As voters in the world’s largest economy prepare to head to the polls on Tuesday, the dollar and the yield on US Treasury bonds fell on Monday as investors pared bets on a Donald Trump victory. The greenback dipped 0.6%
